title.narrative: From Protocol to Practice: A Bridge to Global Action on Forced Labour (The Bridge Project)

description.narrative: This project aims to put the follow-up strategy into practice through five inter-related outcomes: Increased knowledge, awareness, and ratification of the ILO Protocol and Recommendation; Improved and responsive national policies and/or action plans and/or legislation on forced labor with strong implementation, monitoring, and enforcement mechanisms; Increased efforts to collect reliable data in order to carry out research and share knowledge across institutions at national, regional, and global levels; Workers’ and employers’ organizations actively support the fight against forced labor; and Increased awareness and access to livelihood programs for victims of forced labor.

participating-org.narrative: USA, United States Department of Labor, Bureau for International Labor Affairs, Office of Child Labor, Forced Labor and Human Trafficking

department.narrative: Departement of Partnerships and Field Support (PARDEV)

sector.narrative: ILO Results Framework 2020-2021: Output 7.1. Increased capacity of the member States to ensure respect for, promote and realize fundamental principles and rights at work

transaction.ref: MYS/16/50/USA-2019-MYS828 - Forced and child labour eradicated
